docs.lead_paragraph: Updated After Monday's failure of the government's massive bailout package in the House of Representatives - and the ensuing plunge in the market - lawmakers are going back to the drawing board to work on a new proposal that they are likely to take up later this week.

headline.main: The Early Word: Rescuing the Bailout

docs.abstract: Lawmakers on Capitol Hill will continue negotiations on a compromise bill to shore up the country's damaged financial sector.

docs.lead_paragraph: The New York Sun, the six-year-old newspaper with a conservative mind-set, announced on Monday that it would close after publishing Tuesday's issue.

headline.main: New York Sun to Shut Down

docs.abstract: The New York Sun, the six-year-old newspaper with a conservative mind-set, announced on Monday that it would close after publishing Tuesday's issue. The Sun's president and editor, Seth Lipsky, said a three-week search for new financial backers had failed, The New York Times's James Barron reported. Mr. Lipsky announced on Sept. 4, in a front-page [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: 8:40 P.M. (BBC America) GAVIN AND STACEY The wedding day has arrived for the lovebirds (Mathew Horne and Joanna Page, left) in this Season 1 finale, and with it high expectations -- and big worries. Smithy (James Corden) bumbles his best-man speech, Uncle Bryn (Rob Brydon) is acting strangely, and even Nessa (Ruth Jones) isn't herself, what with that secret and all. The real question is whether the wedding will actually take place. 7 A.M. (CBS) THE EARLY SHOW Excerpts from Katie Couric's interview with Gov. Sarah Palin, as well as a look at men who suffer from anorexia. Julia Louis-Dreyfus is a guest (and then moves on to ''Live With Regis and Kelly'' at 9 on ABC); Jennifer Hudson performs.

docs.lead_paragraph: For many of us, elderly parents and adult children alike, nothing is more complicated or consequential than understanding the differences between the many available permutations of long-term care, choosing which is most appropriate for our families and figuring out how to pay for it.

headline.main: Choosing Long-Term Care: Advice From an Expert

docs.abstract: Larry Minnix, president of the American Association of Homes and Services for the Aging, on how to find long-term care.
